narrative.title: 21 Panzer Division - 1942Q3

operations.name: First Battle of El Alamein
operations.role: Defensive operations on El Alamein line after retreat from Gazala
operations.outcome: Success - held line against British attacks, division bloodied but intact

operations.name: Battle of Alam Halfa
operations.role: Left flank of Rommel's offensive, attacking toward western edge of Alam Halfa Ridge vs 22nd Armoured Brigade
operations.outcome: Failure - Offensive stalled by British defense, fuel shortages, air attacks. Commander (von Bismarck) KIA 31 August by mine. Division withdrew after 5-day battle.

situation.combat_effectiveness: Good but declining. Division was veteran formation with excellent tactical skills and equipment quality (long-barrel 75mm and 50mm guns superior to most British tanks). However, by Q3 1942, chronic supply shortages (especially fuel), declining tank strength, and personnel exhaustion degrading effectiveness. Alam Halfa offensive failed partly due to fuel crisis. Death of divisional commander (von Bismarck) significant loss.
notable_engagements: Battle of Alam Halfa (30 Aug - 7 Sept 1942)
Death of Generalmajor von Bismarck (31 August 1942)

narrative.axis_objective: Maintain defensive positions and inflict maximum casualties on Allied forces.
narrative.allied_objective: Advance and secure strategic objectives while minimizing casualties.
